content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic adenocarcinoma

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:		Moderately differentiated pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
		pT3N1M0 (AJCC 8th Ed, Stage IIB)
		KEAP1 mutation detected
		2/18 lymph nodes positive

Current situation:	Post-operative follow-up

[redacted name] attended clinic today following completion of 3 months adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy. She has managed the treatment well with only grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy. Her performance status remains excellent at PS0. Recent CT scan on 15/4/24 shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests including CA19-9 are within normal range. The plan is to continue regular surveillance with 3-monthly CT scans and CA19-9 monitoring. Next clinic review arranged for July 2024 with repeat imaging.

cancer_timeline.value: 2/18 lymph nodes positive on surgical specimen
CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy

status_updates.value: Stage IIB pancreatic cancer post Whipple's procedure. Completed adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX with good tolerance and no evidence of recurrence
grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy from chemotherapy
clinic review in July 2024 with repeat imaging
